greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k such that A039654(k) = prime(n).
comment: We have A039653(k) >= k, thus also A039654(k) >= k, with equality if k is prime, therefore a(n) <= prime(n), and the largest k for which A039654(k) = prime(n) is always k = prime(n).
program: (PARI) a039654(n) = if(n<2, 0, my(m); while((m=sigma(n)-1)!=n, n=m); n);
a(n) = my(k=0, p=prime(n)); while(a039654(k) != p, k++); k; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 26 2017
results.author: _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 25 2017
